verses.text: 問安我這作長老的寫信給親愛的該猶，就是我在真理中所愛的。

words.note: Lit. 'ask about peace'
A leader in the church, literally 'senior old one'
Often used as a term of endearment or address
Refers to divine truth in a biblical context
Indicates the object or result of the following verb

verses.text: 親愛的，我祝你凡事亨通，身體健壯，正如你的靈魂安泰一樣。

words.note: Refers to the non-physical essence of a living being

verses.text: 有些弟兄來到，證實你心中存有真理，就是你按真理行事，我就非常欣慰。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers in a spiritual sense
Lit. 'not regular', thus 'extraordinary, very'

verses.text: 我聽見我的兒女按真理行事，我的喜樂沒有比這更大的了。

words.note: Resultative verb indicating successful hearing
Refers to children in general, not necessarily biological
Often implies a deeper, spiritual joy
Indicates a change of state or new situation

verses.text: 稱讚該猶接待弟兄親愛的，你向弟兄所行的，特別是向外地來的弟兄所行的，都是出於忠心。

words.note: Lit. 'loyal heart'

verses.text: 他們在教會面前證實了你的愛；你照著 神所喜悅的，資助他們的旅程，這樣是好的。

words.note: Refers to the Christian God, usually capitalized.
Used to form a nominal phrase with a verb.

verses.text: 因為他們為主的名出外，並沒有從教外人接受甚麼。

words.note: Here, it emphasizes the negative '沒有'.
Refers to those outside the Christian faith.

verses.text: 所以我們應當接待這樣的人，好讓我們為了真理成為同工。

words.definition: so that, in order to allow

words.note: Often used in a theological or philosophical sense.
Often used in Christian contexts for fellow ministers/workers.

verses.text: 不要效法惡，應該效法善我曾經略略寫信給你那裡的教會，但他們中間那好作領袖的丟特腓不接待我們。

words.definition: to imitate, follow the example of
to imitate, follow the example of

words.note: Pronounced hào (4th tone) when meaning 'to like'.

verses.text: 因此，我來的時候，必要提起他所作的事，就是他用惡言中傷我們；這還不夠，他不但不接待弟兄，還要阻止那些想要接待的人，甚至把他們趕出教會。

words.note: Transforms '我來' (I come) into a nominal phrase 'my coming'.
Used to form a nominal phrase with a verb.
In a religious context, refers to fellow Christians.
Used in the 'bǎ' construction to bring the object before the verb.

verses.text: 親愛的，不要效法惡，應該效法善。行善的屬於 神，作惡的沒有見過 神。

words.note: Often used as a vocative 'My dear ones'.
不要 (bùyào) means 'do not'.
Literally 'imitate a method'.
Can also be an adjective 'evil'.
應該 (yīnggāi) means 'should'.
Literally 'imitate a method'.
Can also be an adjective 'good'.
Verb-object compound, 'do good'.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'one who...'
In biblical context, refers to the singular God.
Verb-object compound, 'do evil'.
Turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'one who...'
沒有 (méiyǒu) means 'not have' or 'did not'.
In biblical context, refers to the singular God.

verses.text: 低米丟行善，有眾人為他作證，真理本身也為他作證。我們也為他作證，你知道我們的見證是真的。

words.note: Verb-object compound, 'do good'.
Literally 'many people'.
Verb-object compound, 'make proof'.
Often used in philosophical or religious contexts.
Verb-object compound, 'make proof'.
Verb-object compound, 'make proof'.
Compound verb 'know the way'.
Literally 'seen evidence'.

verses.text: 問候的話我還有許多話要寫給你，可是我不願借用筆墨。

words.note: Compound verb, 'ask after someone'.
Literally 'many much'.
Can also be 'give' (verb).
不願 (bùyuàn) means 'unwilling'.
More formal or literary term for writing tools.

verses.text: 我盼望很快就見到你，當面談談。

words.note: Compound verb for 'hope and expect'.
很快 (hěnkuài) means 'very soon'.
Compound verb indicating successful seeing.

words.definition: talk a bit, have a chat
words.note: Reduplicated verb for softened or brief action.

verses.text: 願你平安。這裡的朋友都問候你。請你一一提名問候你那裡的朋友。

words.note: Literally 'peace and safety'. Often used as a greeting or blessing.
Compound verb, 'ask after someone'.
Reduplication of 'one' emphasizing sequence.
Verb-object compound, 'mention name'.
Compound verb, 'ask after someone'.
